entry.def: Reins are the thin leather straps attached round a horse's neck which are used to control the horse.
Journalists sometimes use the expression the reins or the reins of power to refer to the control of a country or organization.

example.ex: He was determined to see the party keep a hold on the reins of power...
example.tran: 他决意要确保这个政党掌握政权。

entry.def: If you give free rein to someone, you give them a lot of freedom to do what they want.

example.ex: The government continued to believe it should give free rein to the private sector in transport.
example.tran: 政府仍然认为应该给予交通领域的私营企业以经营自由。

entry.def: If you keep a tight rein on someone, you control them firmly.

example.ex: Her parents had kept her on a tight rein with their narrow and inflexible views.
example.tran: 她的父母观念狭隘而僵化，对她管束很严。
